member.name: IAMPluginControl.GetDisabledByIndex

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Gets a class identifier (CLSID) from the blocked list.

member.param: The zero-based index of the CLSID to retrieve.
Receives the CLSID at the specified index.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The index parameter is out of range.

member.name: IAMPluginControl.GetPreferredClsid

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Searches the preferred list for a class identifier (CLSID) that matches a specified subtype.

member.param: A media subtype GUID to match.
Receives a CLSID from the preferred list.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: No CLSID matching this subtype was found.

member.name: IAMPluginControl.GetPreferredClsidByIndex

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Gets a class identifier (CLSID) from the preferred list, specified by index value.

member.param: The zero-based index of the CLSID to retrieve.
Receives the subtype GUID associated with the CLSID.
Receives the CLSID at the specified index.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The index parameter is out of range.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Queries whether a class identifier (CLSID) appears in the blocked list.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The specified CLSID appears in the blocked list.
The specified CLSID is not in the blocked list.

member.name: IAMPluginControl.IsLegacyDisabled

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Queries whether an Audio Compression Manager (ACM) or Video Compression Manager (VCM) codec appears in the blocked list.

member.param: The name of the DLL that implements the codec.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The specified DLL appears in the blocked list.
The specified DLL is not in the blocked list.

member.name: IAMPluginControl.SetDisabled

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Adds a class identifier (CLSID) to the blocked list, or removes a CLSID from the list.

member.param: The CLSID to add or remove.
Specifies whether to add or remove the CSLID. If the value is TRUE, the method adds the CLSID to the blocked list. Otherwise, the method removes it from the list.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IAMPluginControl.SetPreferredClsid

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Adds a class identifier (CLSID) to the preferred list or removes a CLSID from the list.

member.param: A media subtype GUID to associate with the CLSID.
Pointer to the CLSID to add to the list. If this parameter is NULL, the entry associated with subType is removed from the list
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Controls the preferred and blocked filter lists.
To get a pointer to this interface, call CoCreateInstance. The class identifier (CLSID) is CLSID_DirectShowPluginControl, which is defined in the header file uuids.h.
